parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

> If you do not specify this parameter, the system automatically uses the **request ID** as the **client token**. The **request ID** may be different for each request.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description:
The description of the IPv6 address.

The description must be 0 to 256 characters in length and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform a dry run, without performing the actual request. Valid values:

*   **true**: performs only a dry run. The system checks the request for potential issues, including missing parameter values, incorrect request syntax, and service limits. If the request fails the dry run, an error message is returned. If the request passes the dry run, the `DryRunOperation` error code is returned.
*   **false** (default): performs a dry run and performs the actual request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: Ipv6AddressId
parameters.description: The ID of the IPv6 address.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
The name of the IPv6 address.

The name must be 0 to 128 characters in length and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the IPv6 address. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.
